definition: (coll.) to tattletale/to rat on sb
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
small/tiny/few/young
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: Don't be a rat fink, Jack.
sentences.chinese: 不要可恶地打小报告，杰克。

sentences.english: Discourage gossip, and don't put people in the position of spying or reporting on each other.
sentences.chinese: 制止流言蜚语，不要让人做卧底或者打小报告。

sentences.english: Daughter: A tattletale? Did you just call me a tattletale?
sentences.chinese: 你说我是打小报告的吗？

sentences.english: Those who squeal on colleagues in returnforfavorsare the most hated intheoffice.
sentences.chinese: 办公室里最可恨的就是那些打小报告的人。

sentences.english: I told my teacher on Dolly for stealing my book.
sentences.chinese: 我跟老师打小报告说多莉偷我的书。

sentences.english: Danny always tattles on me when I do something wrong.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼总是在我做错事时打小报告。

definition: to tell on sb/to complain (to a teacher, a superior etc)/to bring a lawsuit
lit. to make sb wear tight shoes (idiom)/to make life difficult for sb
to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
unpleasant talk/malicious words
to retaliate
to make a mess of sth
to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
to gossip/to argue unnecessarily
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
to gossip/to argue unnecessarily
to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
to pick fault with/to spot the differences/to nitpick/to pick a quarrel/to find complaint with
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
behind sb's back
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
